meanings.definition: A person who seeks to impress others by behaving in a showy or ostentatious manner.
meanings.sent1: The grandstander waved enthusiastically to the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She always acted like a grandstander, trying to show off her skills.
meanings.sent3: The grandstander's exaggerated bow drew laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: His grandstanding antics on stage were like a bright spotlight on his ego.
meanings.sent5: The image of the grandstander in a top hat and cane was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To behave in a showy or ostentatious manner in order to impress others.
meanings.sent1: He would grandstand by making big gestures during his speech.
meanings.sent2: Don't grandstand just to get attention; be genuine in your actions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to grandstand by parading around with a toy mouse in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her grandstanding at the party made her seem larger than life.
meanings.sent5: The politician would grandstand by pointing dramatically at the audience.
